intro: Orthosia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled orthosia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in panicles, which are branched clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Orthosia paniculata thrives in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies.
